boardgame.name: Coup: Guatemala 1954
Coup: Rebellion G54
boardgame.description: In Coup: Rebellion G54 (G54), the last player with influence in the game wins, with influence being represented by face-down character cards in your playing area. Before each game players choose five character roles from a randomized deck. Characters have a unique variable power, and the deck is formed by three iterations of each role for fifteen cards total._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A player starts the game with two coins and two influence cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; i.e., two face-down character cards. On your turn, you can take any of the actions of the five characters in play, regardless of which characters you actually have in front of you, or you can take one of two general actions:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Income: Take one coin from the treasury._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Coup: Pay seven coins and launch a coup against an opponent, forcing that player to lose an influence. (If you have ten coins or more, you must take this action.)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;When you take one of the character actions _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; whether actively on your turn, or defensively in response to someone else's action _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; that character's action automatically succeeds unless an opponent challenges you. In this case, if you can't (or don't) reveal the appropriate character, you lose an influence, turning one of your characters face-up. Face-up characters cannot be used, and if both of your characters are face-up, you're out of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If you do have the character in question and choose to reveal it, the opponent loses an influence, then you shuffle that character into the deck and draw a new one, perhaps getting the same character again and perhaps not._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The last player to still have influence _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; that is, a face-down character _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; wins the game!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Coup: Rebellion G54 is a new standalone game that takes the same simple Coup mechanisms and rules, but with a variable deck of 25 characters, and in each game you choose to play with five out of the 25, so the relative power and advantage of each character changes from game to game. This is more of a gamer's game than the original Coup as you can create a deck to increase bluffing, deduction, negotiation or luck._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

YOU ARE BUYING A PRESALE (IN-STOCK BY END OF SEPTEMBER/EARLY OCTOBER 2015) OF... [b]COUP: REBELLION G54 - KICKSTARTER EDITION[/b] PRESALE - 2015 KICKSTARTER EDITION WITH EXCLUSIVES NEVER TO BE FOUND IN RETAIL STORES [b]NEW/SEALED/FREE SHIPPING/SHIPS INTERNATIONALLY/SHIPS WHEN THIS ARRIVES TO OUR WAREHOUSE!!![/b] [b]TONS OF EXCLUSIVES: (Include Exclusive items that won_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t be included in the retail version of G54) •FOIL COINS - INCLUDE BOTH SILVER (VALUE 1) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; GOLD (VALUE 3) - (SEE 3RD PIC) •ANOTHER FULL SET OF 25 EXTRA PLAYER CARDS - ENOUGH TO PLAY UP TO 8 PLAYERS OR SPARES IN CASE YOU EVER DAMAGE ONE. (SEE 4TH PIC) •6 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;THE JESTER_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; CARDS: 5 CARDS + 1 REFERENCE CARD - The Jester can be used as a substitute for the Ambassador and has the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Disorder_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; ability of taking a card from the Court Deck and a card from another player, then returning a card to the Court Deck and a card to the other player. (SEE 5TH PIC) •8 ALTERNATE CRIVE BOST ART _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 4 DIVIDERS - Include two sets of dividers, 4 of each role card, and rule cards with both art for the Crime Boss and let you make the decision on which set to use. (SEE 6TH PIC) •6 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;THE BUREAUCRAT_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; CARDS: 5 CARDS + 1 REFERENCE CARD - The Bureaucrat replaces the Duke, and has the Cooperation ability of the Farmer in G54. Cooperation lets you take 3 coins from the Treasury, but you must give one of those coins to another player. (SEE 7TH PIC) •REVISED/CORRECTED PLAYER AIDS FOR COUP: REFORMATION (SEE LAST PIC) GAME OVERVIEW: [/b] In Coup: Rebellion G54 (G54), the last player with influence in the game wins, with influence being represented by face-down character cards in your playing area. Before each game players choose five character roles from a randomized deck. Characters have a unique variable power, and the deck is formed by three iterations of each role for fifteen cards total. A player starts the game with two coins and two influence cards – i.e., two face-down character cards. On your turn, you can take any of the actions of the five characters in play, regardless of which characters you actually have in front of you, or you can take one of two general actions: •Income: Take one coin from the treasury. •Coup: Pay seven coins and launch a coup against an opponent, forcing that player to lose an influence. (If you have ten coins or more, you must take this action.) When you take one of the character actions – whether actively on your turn, or defensively in response to someone else_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s action – that character_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s action automatically succeeds unless an opponent challenges you. In this case, if you can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t (or don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t) reveal the appropriate character, you lose an influence, turning one of your characters face-up. Face-up characters cannot be used, and if both of your characters are face-up, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re out of the game. If you do have the character in question and choose to reveal it, the opponent loses an influence, then you shuffle that character into the deck and draw a new one, perhaps getting the same character again and perhaps not. The last player to still have influence – that is, a face-down character – wins the game! Coup: Rebellion G54 is a new standalone game that takes the same simple Coup mechanisms and rules, but with a variable deck of 25 characters, and in each game you choose to play with five out of the 25, so the relative power and advantage of each character changes from game to game. This is more of a gamer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s game than the original Coup as you can create a deck to increase bluffing, deduction, negotiation or luck. [b]HAPPY SHOPPING!!! PLEASE CHECK OUT MY GEEKMARKET STORE FOR MORE AWESOME GAMES!!![/b]

Indie Boards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Cards (IBCG541) G54 is the exciting sequel to Rikki_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s award winning game, Coup. G54 is completely stand alone - Coup is not required to play nor do the two games work together. G54 uses the same lightning fast rules found in Coup - claim, counter, challenge and bluff - and then adds an exciting strategic layer via character selection. Before each game starts, five character roles are chosen randomly from 25 different cards. Each of the five characters has a unique ability - the combination of abilities and interplay between them makes each game unique. There are over 5,000 different ways to play!

Selling 1 copy of the multilingual (german/ english/ french/ spanish) First- Edition of Coup: Guatemala 1954, released on Spiel Essen 2014 by La Mame Games. Condition is _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;like_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; NEW, Shrinkwrap removed, All Items present like shown on Picture. Rules in German, English, French and Spanish are included. Played once. Shipment (via DHL): Germany: Parcel (insured) 6,99 € European Union: Parcel (insured) 17,00 € (excluding Overseas and Departments, etc) Russia, Ukraine, Norway, Iceland, Switzerland: Parcel 30,00€ USA, Canada, Israel, Egypt, Tunisia: Parcel 36,00€ All other Countries: please request shipping fee Insurance is up to 500€. See also: http://www.dhl.de/en/paket/preise/preise-international.html Payment: Within Euro-zone the EU-standard-bank-transfer (SEPA, IBAN/BIC) is recommended, it´s quick, save and causes no fees. Paypal is certainly also possible, fees within EU are 0,35 Euro + 1,9% of the total. Worldwide (outside the EURO-zone) Paypal is recommended. Since October 2011 PP-fees are 0,35 Euro + (3,9% - 5,2%) of the total + (if used) credit-card-fees. For nearly all countries outside Europe, apart from USA and Canada (both 3,9%), the rate is 5.2%. Paypal does not allow uninsured shipment above 25 Euro (exception personal payments) and shipments to any other address than the one submitted with the payment. The fees of the payment method you choose and the real shipping costs the buyer have to pay.
